column4: Hi, can I use a Feisty Fawn CD for a 'Software Update' instead of downloading everyhting from the net, or do I have to boot the CD and *then* do the install?
s...Fetching & installing cannot be cancelled.
It doesn't say that it we get its files from the CD.
THE QUESTION IS:  HOW CAN I BE SURE IT WILL USE THE CD?
it will where it can
which version of ubuntu are you using?
click on system - about ubuntu
Ximal, Ubuntu 7.04 - the Feisty Fawn
so the first thing I ask you do to is to unplug the camera from the machine and put it in a different usb port
tried, that, also first USB port was the one I use for Flash Sticks...
so did the camera turn itself on and ask you to "ok" connected to computer?
also, have used the similar line of cameras at work with Win-XP, so I'm familiar with the cameras themselves.
no, it didn't, but then it doesn't under Win-XP with no special Canon software installed.
camera problem check battery - it needs to "wake up" when on usb port or else you can't have the flash inside it mount as a mass storage device
proof, start applications, accessories, terminal, in there type lsusb and I guess it does not see the device
fresh batts, & taken ~15 photos this afternoon.
Bus 001 Device 001: ID 0000:0000  <<< same as when unplugged

your usb on the camera is not talking to the machine - I stick by my earlier call problem on camera end - if it does not show up on lsusb you got no hope of it talking to it - shouting into the void so to speak, pointless exercise
thanks ... will take to work on 27th & try there... if no go, then will take camera back
does your machine have or you have card reader?
no card reader, just some USB memory sticks which work OK
you could see where that was going, I think you need to find one before you bring it to shop get your photos
I've got a second machine here, same 7.04, but motherboard is only 18 months old, not about 6 years.  Will try that first.
thanks for your efforts, but no joy with camera... will try at work on 27th.  BFN. Alf
